result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin J. Schultz was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J. Schultz

records.addlTxt: Huber

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[ml] Case called at 1:31PM
Defendant Kevin J. Schultz in court with Attorney Nicholas John Rifelj. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered as to Count #1; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence FORTHWITH
--Mr. Schultz is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--maintain absolute sobriety
--not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor store
--if permitted to travel out of state: no possession or use of marijuana (THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of the Agent
--pay all costs and fees
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders outright:
--Payment of a fine in the amount of $1,500.00
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment per the Agent
--Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel attendance 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$2,958.00] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 60 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

Days credit for time already served: 3 days

recess 1:59PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 10:19 AM 
Defendant Kevin J. Schultz in court.    Attorney Nicholas John Rifelj in court for Kevin J. Schultz. Hailey Shelton and ADA Brookellen Teuber appear for the State of Wisconsin under the student practice rule. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 10:22am 

NEXT: Plea & Sentencing on 9/29/22 at 1:30pm
Arraignment on July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kevin J. Schultz in court with Attorney Nicholas Rifelj.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Schultz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
ADA Beck requests that Arraignment be scheduled on a later date, indicating that the State is awaiting blood-test results.
Attorney Rifelj requests that the next hearing be scheduled on a date farther out.

Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Conditions of Bond include: --no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores; no presence in the liquor section of grocery stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Wisconsin drivers license
--Mr. Schultz is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**   
--the Court will allow for urine screens to be sure there is compliance.

Reserve Judge Moroney presiding for Branch III Intake: 
[MK] case called at 1:22pm 
Defendant Kevin J. Schultz appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Mr. Schultz does not qualify for PD representation).   Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Right to counsel is given through a summary provided by Attorney Rumpf. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 
The Court requires a $2,500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores; no presence in the liquor section of grocery stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Wisconsin drivers license
--Mr. Schultz is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
 --the Court will allow for urine screens to be sure there is compliance.  
recess 1:29pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on March 18th at 9:00am
